reviews.review: 按现在的游戏来说流程是有些短的，但故事绝对精彩
玩完愣了，还去找了是否有别的结局，又看了遍剧情解说，才确定是真的。要是时光永远停在沙滩上跳舞的伊丽莎白该多好
美工做得真的好看，剧情也很有深度，值得入正！但是为什么总是正在完成安装啊，第一次运气好进了，之后就怎么也进不了了
Помню как в 2012-2014 об этой игре говорили все и, честно говоря, она этого достойна. Мне больше нравится атмосфера первых двух биошоков, но эта игра тоже вполне хороша.

没啥好说的，就是困难难度一护盾一小兵，一周目不熟悉技能战斗有点耗时间。年度游戏级别，可惜2013年遇到了gta5和最后的生还者1.。。。刚刚打完 加dlc15小时。1代9分，2代9.5分，无限9.9分。系列剧情加起来10分，打完1，2，无限才知道为什么3带要叫无限不叫3了，没想明白最佳叙事怎么输的。大表哥打哭了，这个没打哭。但我认为比大表哥两部曲剧情更强。（ps：无限 dlc 海葬第二章 最后一段代入感过强可能会犯恶心【非画面恶心，心理不适】，我缓了五分钟，呼吸困难要晕倒的感觉）。

第一个二周目的游戏
近期打折入手了大包，尽管是8年前的游戏但从刚开始精美的画风就吸引着我，这种蒸汽朋克风真的太可了，剧情代入感很强，玩到最后感觉伊丽莎白是一个活生生的形象刻在我心里，最后的剧情我是真的没想到。我在洛圣都飙过车，也在塞尔维亚打过仗，在法国大革命时当过一名没有感情的刺客，但是我一直忘不了在云端之上的城市和在海边跳舞的伊丽莎白

No lo había jugado antes ni me interesaba, lo consideraba un "shooter genérico". Lo compré para jugarlo, y la narrativa te envuelve completamente. Considero que su principal fuerte es la historia que te van contando, la cual se vuelve más profunda conforme se reflexiona en ella, y en general, es lo suficientemente entretenido para volver a jugarlo aunque ya conozcas lo que va a pasar.

I notice a theme with this game series: Beautiful city in a place where even modern technology wouldn't be able to build it, much less the tech of the era... and it's run by total lunatics. And dear God, this one is probably even more messed up than the first two - and I didn't think that possible.

I'll change this review once I beat it, but this game is a complete failure. If you liked any of the previous Shock games then don't bother, Colombia is a laughable world that puts looking pretty and being navigable by a child over being sensible or deep. No  more map, to make sure you've explored everywhere and have a sense of the location, now there's just an arrow button to lead you to the next fetch quest objective.

If you like FPS games, don't bother. Infinite has a greater weapon variety than previous, but a 2 weapon limit, which means you don't get the same sense of attachment to your guns as you did previously, they don't stick around for more than a few minutes before running out of ammo. Bullet sponge enemies return, ensuring only the most powerful weapons (namely the sniper) are anywhere near satisfying.

If you like political stories or quantum mechanics, don't bother. What holds Infinite back is how simultaneously hard and soft it goes on its themes. Colombia is a straw-city of nationalism turned to racism, but outside of "racism is bad, black people have to hide their intelligence because the whites are insecure, but they also heavily advertise a Chinese gun mechanic by the name of Chen Lin". I've lost count of the times I encountered signs saying "racial purity" or something of the sort in all manner of places, really for no other reason than to be shocking. This game is so edgy it hurts, maybe racism is used to control people, but any exploration of how nationalism leads to racism or how a malicious government can manipulate the populace into being racist is missing. All of the racism stuff, along with some The Jungle-esque classism feels like it's for its own sake, for the player to be shocked. It's not shocking though, it's cartoonish. This includes the "abolitionist" household having 2 giant replicas of the same painting of Lincoln proudly displayed when that would be rather foolish in their location, or the giant JW Booth statue. A lot of this goes for the Quantum BS throughout as well. There's one mention of probability, which is obviously a big deal with quantum mechanics, but besides that none of it is informative nor internally consistent. It's magic that works however Ken Levine thought would be the coolest. Becoming crazy when another universe's version of you being the most glaring issue.

This game treats you like you're dumb, no discussion of heady themes, just that racism is bad and (smokes weed while listening to deGrasse Tyson) "science is crazy man". The gameplay is an oversimplification from a greatly simplified source, the depth of Bioshock 1 and 2 mostly came in environmental planning, but now Infinite's maps feel stripped from CoD, which really breaks down the combat, it was just never designed for these kinds of maps with a long time to kill across long sight lines being just one  of the sins committed. 

The soundtrack (mostly the rewritten licensed songs) is really nice, the visuals are genuinely pretty, Elizabeth warming back up to you is handled well, but Elizabeth on the whole is the weakest part of this game. There's a conversation where she confides in Booker that she's insecure about being weird due to her powers, however this is the first mention of any social inadequacy from her. She is a Disney princess despite her horrid upbringing. She is the emotional core of the story, and the devs were too scared people wouldn't like her, so she's portrayed as the social butterfly while Booker is the one out of his element, a little brash and awkward. Her have difficulties from her past would've been more realistic, and also would have better portrayed the relationship they were evoking between Booker and Elizabeth. Having her be emotionally damaged, distant, and otherwise effected by her time in isolation would have been the riskier, but ultimately more rewarding and sensible, route to take. Infinite was afraid of taking that risk I presume, outgoing and compassionate people are easier to like so that's what they made Elizabeth, a Disney princess because they didn't trust the player to care about her otherwise. 

This game pulled the medium back upon release, the racism it needs to be entirely overdone and cartoony, the gameplay and level design has to be simplified to allow for less choices, the science is all explained away with "quantum whatevers" or a poor understanding of probability and constants, Fitzroy has to be evil to show revenge is bad, Elizabeth needs to be unaffected by her past so the player likes her. All of these decisions that hold the game back feel like the result of low expectations of the consumer as much as incompetence on part of the devs.

Gameplay is extremely bland, this game purely lives from the richness of its setting, which it doesnt explore beyond the heavily linear segments, which remind of old school string of pearl models. Very disappointing title, doesn't come even close to the elegance of the old parts.

The Bioshock Saga is one of the best games you can ever play. The events on Bioshock Infinite closed a wonderful "time and space" cycle that involves Bioshock 1. I love the concept art, music, story, environment of Infinite. It is incredible how original this studio and their DV group can be with these games. I enjoyed every second of it, the story is so rich and complex and you always want more.

I really really enjoyed it ♥. Thank you for making this wonderful saga. I totally recommend it

PS: The only two things I didndt like was the auto save only, which is really annoying sometimes, and the fact that anyone on Columbia uses Vigors like you. On Rapture you fight against enemies who has the same plasmids as you (splicers) so they are more difficult to defeat. In fact the DLC "Burial at Sea" was more difficult (in the same difficult mode than Infinite) than the main game.

Nereden başlasam bilemiyorum açıkçası. Bu oyunu oynamayı o kadar çok istemişimdir ki ama kötü bir sistemim olduğu için bir türlü oynayamamıştım ta ki bu zamana kadar, çıkışından 8 sene sonra. İyi ki oynamışım, hikayesi, grafikleri, oynanışı, her şeyi ile mükemmel, vuruş hissi hariç. Uzun zamandır beni bu kadar etkileyen bir oyun olmamıştı. Oyun ile ilgili tek keşkem ''keşke mutlu son olsaydı'' oldu veya ''devamı gelebilecek bir son''. Neyse umarım bu tarzda ve kalitede daha çok oyun görürüz. Kesinlikle alın ve oynayın gerçekten pişman olmayacaksınız.
